subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Women Peranakan costumes Children
physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady and two children. The lady sits in the middle while the two children stand on either side. All of them are wearing their ethnic costumes, and the children have their headdresses on but not the lady. The child on the right has a tasselled headdress.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a seated nyonya in a baju panjang flanked by two boys wearing headdresses. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of seated nyonya with two children
